definitions.title: n.pr.f.
definitions.body: Ashera (As. n.pr.f. Aš-ra-tu, c. sign for deity, in Canaanitish n.pr. Abad-Ašratum, servant of A. Schr:ZA 1888, 363, cf. Wkl & Abel:Thontafelfund v. El Amarna ii. No. 77, 1.9, & Sayce:RP2. ii. 67, iii. 71; on deriv. cf. As. aširat, adj. fem. gracious, COT:Gloss):—usually with the art.: prob.

definitions.title: a.
definitions.body: a Canaanitish goddess of fortune & happiness; having prophets 1Ki 18:19, an image 1Ki 15:13 = 2Ch 15:16, 2Ki 21:7, sacred vessels 2Ki 23:4, houses v:2Ki 23:7.

definitions.title: b.
definitions.body: a symbol of this goddess, a sacred tree or pole set up near an altar 1Ki 16:33, 2Ki 13:6, 2Ki 17:16, 2Ki 18:4, 2Ki 21:3, 2Ki 23:6, 2Ki 23:15; prohibited De 16:1; burnt by Gideon Ju Jdg 6:25, Jdg 6:26, Jdg 6:28, Jdg 6:30. Pl. [[אֲשֵׁרוֹת]]

definitions.title: a.
definitions.body: the goddess Ju Jdg 3:7 (prob. error for [[עַשְׁתָּרׂת]] Vulgate).
